p: There are various mapping methods used for converting the nucleotide bases from strings A, T, C and G to numbers, so the GSP techniques can be applied to them. The electron–ion interaction pseudopotential (EIIP) representation is one of these mapping methods [ 32–35]. The EIIP values symbolize the free electrons’ energy distribution along the nucleotide sequence [ 36]. These values are 0.1260, 0.1335, 0.1340 and 0.0806 for A, T, C and G, respectively.
